description: Variation of conditions 7 (Protective Measures) and 3a (Archaeology/Historic Building Recording) pursuant to Listed Building Consent dated 01/12/2017 (Ref 2017/1847) for Demolition of existing warehouse buildings and erection of a 2 - 6 storey building comprising 34 x residential (Class C3) units, flexible commercial floorspace (Class A1/A2/A3/A4) and office space (Class B1a) at ground floor; restoration works, alterations and rear extensions to existing 1-9 Church Row Listed Buildings to enable the change of use from office (Class B1) to residential (Class C3) comprising 1 x dwellinghouse and 15 x flats; provision of associated landscaping, refuse storage and cycle parking; and public access to the River Wandle from Wandsworth Plain. (Linked to Variation of Condition Application 2020/2745).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - A) No development, including the laying of the ground beam shown in approved drawings 1634 HT P 120; 121 500; 1634 200 SK01, shall take place until the applicant (or their heirs and successors in title) has secured the implementation of a rapid programme of Level I assessment, in accordance with a Written Scheme of Investigation relating to the area in which the ground beam will be laid has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the local planning authority. 
B) Under Part A, the applicant (or their heirs and successors in title) shall implement a rapid programme of Level I assessment in accordance with a Written Scheme of Investigation.
C) A report on the Part B assessment has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing that identifies to what level of mitigation recording each structure should be undertaken.
D) No development including demolition shall take place until the applicant (or their heirs and successors in title) has secured the implementation of a programme of building recording mitigation in accordance with a Written Scheme of Investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the local planning authority in writing and a report on that evaluation has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing.
E) Under Part D, the applicant (or their heirs and successors in title) shall implement a programme building recording mitigation in accordance with a Written Scheme of Investigation.
F) The development shall not be occupied until the site investigation and post-investigation assessment has been completed in accordance with the programme set out in the Written Scheme of Investigation approved under Parts (A and D), and the provision for analysis, publication and dissemination of the results and archive deposition has been secured.
(E) A copy of the recording taken shall be provided to the Local Planning Authority's Conservation and Design team and local history libra

Condition : 2 - Protective measures during demolition works on site, and during the works necessary in relation to the laying of the ground beam shown in approved drawings 1634 HT P 120; 121 500; 1634 200 SK01, and especially for the brick passages through 1-6 Church Row and for the retained interiors, shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval prior to commencement of development of works which concern the listed buildings excluding demolition. Works shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved measures 
In order to protect the historic buildings in accordance with Council policy DMS2. It is necessary for this condition to be discharged prior to commencement of works to ensure that no harm is caused to heritage assets on site during construction.

Condition : 3 - The development hereby approved shall be begun by 01/12/2020. 
Reason: To comply with the requirements of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Condition : 4 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings and specifications:-


1634-HT-D-099; 1634-HT-D-100; 1634-HT-D-101; 1634-HT-D-102; 1634-HT-D-103; 1634-HT-D-200; 1634-HTD-201; 1634-HT-D-202; 1634-HT-D-203; 1634-HT-D-204; 1634-HT-D-205; 1634-HT-D-300; 1634-HT-D-301; 1634-HT-D-302; 1634-HT-D-303; 1634-HT-D-304; 1634-HT-D-305;

1634-HT-I-099; 1634-HT-I-100 P1; 1634-HT-I-101 P1; 1634-HT-I-102; 1634-HT-I-103;

1634-HT-P-099; 1634-HT-P- 100 P3; 1634-HT-P-101 P3; 1634-HT-P-102 P2; 1634-HT-P-103 P2; 1634-HT-P-104; 1634-HT-P-105; 1634-HT-P-106; 1634-HT-P-200 P2; 1634-HT-P-201 P2; 1634-HT-P-202 P2; 1634-HT-P-203; 1634-HT-P-204 P3; 1634-HT-P-205; 1634-HT-P-300; 1634-HT-P-301; 1634-HT-P-302; 1634-HT-P-303 P2; 1634-HT-P-304; 1634-HT-P-305 P2; 1634-HT-P-010 P2; 1634-HT-P-020 P2; and P10862 00 001 101 P10.

1634 HT P 120; 121 500; 1634 200 SK01

Unless approved otherwise in writing by the local planning authority.  
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 5 - Details of the materials listed below to be used in the historic buildings shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement of the relevant works. The works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details. 

- All new materials and fixtures and fittings relating to new works to and/or in close proximity (extensions) to the historic external fabric.

- Replacement brick where applicable
- Paint finishes
- Stone
- Cast iron railings and grilles
- Mortar sample
- Brick bond
- Replacement tile where applicable
- New tile (extension)
- Reclaimed brick (extension)
- New windows (extension)

- Internal - all new materials and fixtures and fittings relating to new works to the interiors, including fire protection measures.

In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials and works, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 and DMS2. It is necessary for the condition to be discharged prior to the commencement of works to ensure suitable materials are used in the proposal and do not harm heritage assets.

Condition : 7 - Motion sensors shall to be fitted to the retained buildings on site to monitor movement during construction on site. The findings of the monitoring shall be submitted to the local planning authority prior to occupation of any part of the development.
In order to protect the historic buildings in accordance with Council policy DMS2.

Condition : 8 - Details of ventilation for proposed bathrooms and kitchens and how any historic panelling/fabric will be protected shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval in writing prior to those works being undertaken. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
In order to protect the historic buildings in accordance with Council policy DMS2.
